types.section:
{{head|fr|conjunction}}

# {{lb|fr|Early Modern French}} because, therefore, for that cause

====Usage notes====
If used with {{m|fr|que}} (''pource que'') it is ancestor of modern French {{m|fr|parce que}}.

Definition taken from Cotsgrave's 1611 Dictionary of the England and French Tongues
types.html:
pource

  1. (Early Modern French) because, therefore, for that cause

Usage notes

[edit]

If used with que (pource que) it is ancestor of modern French parce que.

Definition taken from Cotsgrave's 1611 Dictionary of the England and French Tongues

title: pource
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /puʁs/
